name: Sawn lumber, hardwood, rough, green, at sawmill, NE-NC
description:
Allocation based on mass.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology. Some data extrapolated from similar processes.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Questionnaires from 20 mills (17 companies) from the 20 states of Forest Service (FS) Northeastern (NE) Region. Hardwood sawmills were members of the Hardwood Manufacturer Association (HMA).
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Only mass allocation factors are available for the multi-functional processes (disregard economic allocation factor values-they are mass allocation factors).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: NE/NC = Northeast (NE) and Northcentral (NC) United States.  The 20 states are Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Vermont, West Virginia, Wisconsin.

sources.name: Andrew J. Baker (1983). New Findings on Wood Values

exchanges.description: Weight reported on an ovendry basis.  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 87%

flow.name: Sawn lumber; hardwood; rough; green; at sawmill
Disposal, solid waste, unspecified, to inert material landfill
